tweet: Good news for Canadian farmers today: Canadian pork and beef exports to China will resume. Thanks to Ambassador Barton and the Canadian meat industry for their work on re-opening this important market for our meat producers and their families.

Today, we announce Dominic Barton as Canada’s Ambassador to China. Dominic’s experience in Asia & expertise in global economics will make him a great representative of Canada & Canadian interests in China. More:  https://pm.gc.ca/en/news/news-releases/2019/09/04/prime-minister-announces-appointment-dominic-barton-ambassador-china …

Packed business trip, 1 goal:  Growing our economy & creating jobs for Canadians.  ✅Meetings with heads of 16 Asian companies looking to invest here. ✅Bilateral meetings with China, Singapore, Japan, Malaysia & Australia. ✅Working sessions with leaders from around the world.  pic.twitter.com/CM54Znt5HT

Very good to speak with Premier Li again as part of our annual China-Canada dialogue. We had a productive & frank discussion on expanding ties, creating good jobs for people in both our countries, human rights, climate change & reducing plastic pollution:  http://bit.ly/2TdjBxx  pic.twitter.com/aW0feiERbP

This afternoon in Toronto, I met with the CEO of China & Co-CEO of Asia Pacific for @MorganStanley, Wei Sun Christianson. We had a good discussion about how increased trade in the Asia Pacific region can create more jobs & opportunities for the middle class here at home. pic.twitter.com/yT7lGQxjHv

The loss of life and destruction caused by typhoon Mangkhut are heartbreaking. To everyone affected in the Philippines, China and the region - we're keeping you in our thoughts & we’re ready to offer help and support with recovery efforts:  http://bit.ly/2NhU72B

We’ve wrapped up a busy visit to China, focused on growing the Canada-China relationship to create more jobs & opportunities for Canadians:  https://pm.gc.ca/eng/news/prime-minister-successfully-concludes-second-official-visit-china-keynote-address-fortune …
On our last day in China, we visited the Chen Clan Academy for an eye-dotting ceremony and lion dance.  pic.twitter.com/XcDIcmV8DY
This morning in Guangzhou, we sat down with Vice Premier Wang Yang to talk about the benefits of increasing trade and investment between Canada & China.  pic.twitter.com/oTMFj6wv3Q
Good meeting with Chairman Zhang Dejiang earlier today, focused on strengthening the Canada-China relationship.  pic.twitter.com/8eRPSoY10V

A very busy Day 2 in China - my thanks to President Xi Jinping for his hospitality, and to the many Canadian businesspeople here this week to help grow their companies, access bigger markets and create jobs.  pic.twitter.com/WCTgzcrCCy
Excellent talks with Premier Li in Beijing today - any possible trade deal with China will need to reflect the values & priorities of Canadians.  pic.twitter.com/7CgTgk0yEa

I’m happy to announce new partnerships with China that will increase trade, protect the environment, and create more jobs & opportunities for people in both our countries.  https://pm.gc.ca/eng/news/2017/12/04/canada-announces-new-partnerships-china-grow-shared-prosperity …

The Canadian delegation arrived at the Great Hall of the People in Beijing earlier today to strengthen ties between Canada & China. My thanks to Premier Li for the warm welcome.  pic.twitter.com/h8rhLgLkNu
Talking about all that Canada has to offer at Sina Weibo in Beijing today. Come visit during the Canada-China Year of Tourism!  http://bit.ly/2AtIX1f  pic.twitter.com/mqXdPxXj7W
Wheels up - heading back to Asia for a busy week focused on increasing trade and tourism between Canada & China.
Next week, I'll travel to China to strengthen the relationship between our countries. More:  https://pm.gc.ca/eng/news/2017/11/26/prime-minister-strengthen-bilateral-and-commercial-ties-trip-china …
Talking trade & Canada’s relationship with China. Nice to catch up with my friend & our Ambassador to China @HonJohnMcCallum today. pic.twitter.com/N5mbSk9Q59
It’s like the banner says. Canola farmers grow our economy – that’s why we’re helping them access markets in China & around the world.  pic.twitter.com/Hzqqxxm5yp

Today's progress is vital to advancing Canada's interests by building a strong, stable relationship with China, grounded in mutual respect.

After such a warm welcome in China, it will be my pleasure to host Premier Li Keqiang in Canada later this month:  http://pm.gc.ca/eng/news/2016/09/14/premier-state-council-peoples-republic-china-li-keqiang-visit-canada …

Canada-China cooperation on climate change helps us build a clean growth economy & create jobs - a historic opportunity to work together.
